edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.multi

Interface AbstractMultifilteredStream<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BifilteredMetricStream, PrimitiveMultifilteredStream

    public interface AbstractMultifilteredStream<T>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>

    • Method Detail

      • getFiltrationValue

        double[] getFiltrationValue(T basisElement)
        This function returns the filtration multi-index of the requested basis element.
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the basis element to get the filtration multi-index for
        Returns:
        the filtration multi-index of the specified basis element

      • getBoundary

        T[] getBoundary(T basisElement)
        This function returns the elements in the boundary of the supplied basisElement, without the coefficients. We do not integrate the elements of the boundary array with their respective coefficients since this interface is designed to be independent of the algebraic environment.
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the element to get the boundary of
        Returns:
        an array containing the boundary elements of the queried element

      • getBoundaryCoefficients

        int[] getBoundaryCoefficients(T basisElement)
        This function returns the coefficients of the boundary of the supplied basis element. Note that in many cases, this will be the standard array consisting of alternating signs: [1, -1, 1, -1, ...]. However, this will not always be the case. Thus this must be left abstract. Also note that the coefficients will always be integers.
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the element to get the boundary coefficients of
        Returns:
        an array containing the boundary coefficients of the queried element

      • getDimension

        int getDimension(T basisElement)
        This function returns the dimension of a basis element within the chain complex.
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the element to get the dimension of
        Returns:
        the dimension of the basis element within the chain complex

      • finalizeStream

        void finalizeStream()
        This function prepares the stream for use by a consumer, such as the PersistentHomology class. After finalization, the stream cannot not be modified by adding or removing elements. In practice, the finalize procedure will probably do some sorting and construction of data structures necessary for iterating through the stream.

      • isFinalized

        boolean isFinalized()
        This function checks whether the finalize() function has been called.
        Returns:
        true if the stream has been finalized, and false otherwise

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        This function returns the total number of elements in the stream.
        Returns:
        the size of the stream

      • getBasisComparator

        java.util.Comparator<T> getBasisComparator()
        This function returns a comparator on the underlying basis type.
        Returns:
        a comparator on the underlying basis type

      • transform

        <G> PersistenceInvariantDescriptor<Interval<java.lang.Double>,G> transform(PersistenceInvariantDescriptor<Interval<java.lang.Integer>,G> barcodeCollection)
        This function transforms the given collection of filtration index barcodes into filtration value barcodes.
        Type Parameters:
        G -
        Parameters:
        barcodeCollection - the set of filtration index barcodes
        Returns:
        the barcodes transformed into filtration value form
